us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface Line3DBasics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, Line3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameLine3DBasics, FrameLine3DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameLine3D, Line3D

    public interface Line3DBasics
extends Line3DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable
    Write and read interface for a line 3D.

    A line 3D represents an infinitely long line in 3 dimensions and defined by a point and a direction.

      • containsNaN

        default boolean containsNaN()
        Tests if this line contains Double.NaN.
        Specified by:
        containsNaN in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable
        Returns:
        true if getPoint() and/or getDirection() contains Double.NaN, false otherwise.

      • setToZero

        default void setToZero()
        Sets the point and vector of this line to zero. After calling this method, this line becomes invalid. A new valid point and valid vector will have to be set so this line is again usable.
        Specified by:
        setToZero in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable

      • setToNaN

        default void setToNaN()
        Sets the point and vector of this line to Double.NaN. After calling this method, this line becomes invalid. A new valid point and valid vector will have to be set so this line is again usable.
        Specified by:
        setToNaN in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable

      • negateDirection

        default void negateDirection()
        Flips this line's direction.

        Changes the point through which this line has to go.
        Parameters:
        pointOnLineX - the new x-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineY - the new y-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineZ - the new z-coordinate of the point on this line.

        lineDirectionY - the new y-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionZ - the new z-component of the direction of this line.

      • set

        default void set(Line2DReadOnly line2DReadOnly)
        Sets this line to represent the same geometry as the given line2DReadOnly.

        After calling this method this line is in the XY-plane.

        Parameters:
        line2DReadOnly - the other line to copy. Not modified.

        After calling this method this line is in the XY-plane.

        Parameters:

      • set

        default void set(double pointOnLineX,
                 double pointOnLineY,
                 double pointOnLineZ,
                 double lineDirectionX,
                 double lineDirectionY,
                 double lineDirectionZ)
        Redefines this line with a new point and a new direction vector.
        Parameters:
        pointOnLineX - the new x-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineY - the new y-coordinate of the point on this line.
        pointOnLineZ - the new z-coordinate of the point on this line.
        lineDirectionX - the new x-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionY - the new y-component of the direction of this line.
        lineDirectionZ - the new z-component of the direction of this line.

      • set

        default void set(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly firstPointOnLine,
                 us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly secondPointOnLine)
        Redefines this line such that it goes through the two given points.

        After calling this method this line is in the XY-plane.

        Parameters:
        firstPointOnLine - first point on this line. Not modified.
        secondPointOnLine - second point on this line. Not modified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the two given points are exactly equal.

      • translate

        default void translate(double x,
                       double y,
                       double z)
        Translates this line by the given (x, y, z).

        Note that this line's direction remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        x - the distance to translate this line along the x-axis.
        y - the distance to translate this line along the y-axis.
        z - the distance to translate this line along the z-axis.

        Transforms this line using the given homogeneous transformation matrix.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
